meanings.sent1: She disaffirmed the accusation against her.
meanings.sent2: He always disaffirms any wrongdoing on his part.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to disaffirm the evidence of the broken vase by looking innocent.
meanings.sent4: His actions disaffirm his words, showing a lack of honesty.
meanings.sent5: The storm's destruction disaffirmed any hope of a peaceful evening.

meanings.definition: To refuse to acknowledge or accept
meanings.sent1: They disaffirm any responsibility for the mistake.
meanings.sent2: The student chose to disaffirm the teacher's explanation.
meanings.sent3: The dog seemed to disaffirm the command to sit, preferring to chase its tail instead.
meanings.sent4: Her stubbornness disaffirms any compromise in the negotiation.
meanings.sent5: The closed sign on the door disaffirms any hope of entering the store.
